items.text: back of a length on leg, trying to go for the short ball. But wide called
items.shortText: Little to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 wide

items.text: full, on off, and Shakib covers his off stump before defending towards point
items.shortText: Little to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: full on middle, and worked off his pads behind square on the leg side. Protection there though
items.shortText: Little to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: what do we have here?! Back of a length on off from around the wicket, and a check-pull from Liton has taken a top-edge. Enough behind that shot to clear fine leg. Tiny, tiny ground here at Clontarf
items.postText: Imam: "Kaleem, of course BD have not achieved anything that can be compared to Pakistan's accomplishments in international cricket. However, correct me if I am wrong, have not Pak lost all ODIs they played against BD after 2015 WC? I do see some consistency here. "
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, SIX runs

items.text: back of a length, slower ball outside off. He mistimes a flat-batted shot to mid off
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length ball, on off, and he guides a shot to third man. Chopped down to the fielder there
items.postText: JoeBiden: "Unpopular opinion but it's so fun when Bangladesh and India go head to head just cause both these countries have the most vocal fans and all the spice"
items.shortText: Little to Liton Das, 2 runs

items.text: length ball, on off, and punched down the ground to long on
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: tossed up outside off, and Liton picks the length early. Hammers an inside-out cover drive through to the boundary
items.postText: Farhan: "@NK: Don't make the big talks yet my fellow BD fans, as we are yet to walk the big walks. Team BD is very likely to make us choke on our words in the WC if not in this tri-series. So keep calm and keep supporting without drumming them up so much. "
items.shortText: Dockrell to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: flighted again, full on off. Tapped to extra cover for one
items.shortText: Dockrell to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: quicker one, angling into his pads. Worked away to square leg
items.postText: Tarif Sherhan: "@shahed: Tamim, although a very good batsman, is not an IPL material. I don't mean he needs to be better for IPL. He is already good. Some very good players are just not a good suit to IPL. "
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: worked off his pads to square leg
items.shortText: Dockrell to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length ball outside off, but turning inwards. Firmly struck off the back foot to long on for one
items.postText: Kaz: "People praising Bangladesh, this is a tri series with Windies and Ireland, real minnows in today's ODI cricket and Windies without half of the stars."
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run
McCarthy to Shakib Al Hasan, no run
McCarthy to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: breakthrough! The stumps are broken. Liton 24 short of a hundred. Was a full ball, but slightly slower, and Liton's through his shot too early. Smart delivery
items.shortText: McCarthy to Liton Das, OUT

items.text: first-ball four! Overpitched on leg, and flicked off his toes to the leg-side fence
items.postText: KARIM: "Bangladesh can think themselves extremely unlucky that their middle order hasn't been tested in this series. 90 % of there runs was scored by top 4. I would like to see a massive collapse and let's see how they cope up with that situation? "
items.shortText: McCarthy to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: full, just wide outside off, and he toe-ends a drive to cover
items.postText: Abu Sufian: "Well,If KKR decides to change their approach and go for solidity,Tamim could be good patrner alongside Chris Lynn." -- Interesting call. Smart choice too given the Bengali connect with the team. Could help them build more fans as well
items.shortText: McCarthy to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: length ball on middle, and he uncomfortably nudges a shot to the leg side. They scamper across for one
items.postText: imran: "@KAZ: please don't be so disrespect full to Ireland, after all they have beaten very good sides and no team should take them lightly."
items.shortText: McCarthy to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full, on off, and he toe-ends a drive to wide long off
items.shortText: Dockrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: length ball on off, and turning inwards. Punched to long on
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length ball on middle, and worked off his waist to the vacant square-leg region
items.shortText: Dockrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: tossed up outside off, and driven straight back to the bowler
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: full on off, and driven down the ground to long on for a jogging single
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length ball, wide outside off and turning away. Cut square to deep point
items.shortText: Dockrell to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText:
Ashikur: "BD wins when everybody contributes equally portions towards big total. There rarely one/two batters' show. Batsmen cannot covert half-ton to complete century. Also they struggle for singles. LONG way to go, A LOT to improve."

Sahil Kanwar: "Ireland have shown promise since last 8 years if I remember and have been a force to reckon but never been consistent." -- yeah, what's plagued their progress is that there are too many veterans in the side with little pressure from players trying to break into the XI from the grassroot level
items.text: length ball on leg, and hits his front leg. But this is going down leg
items.shortText: McCarthy to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
